award_title: Collaborative Research: PurSUiT: The diversity and evolution of extremophilic microbial eukaryotes
subject: Your protist data could outlive the paper
body:
Dr. Oliverio,

You're building something valuable with the extremophilic microbial eukaryote workâ€”biodiversity databases, strain collections, new species descriptions. But let's be honest: most of that will be underutilized once the project wraps because it's hard for others to actually plug into.

Ouro helps turn computational workflows, datasets, and notebooks into reusable building blocks that others in your field can actually plug into their work.

Given the collaborative nature of your research and the training components you're running, it might be worth a look.

If you're curious, I can show you how it works.

Wishing you a restful winter break and happy holidays.

Best,

Matt Moderwell
https://ouro.foundation
